nodes.bodyText: Remove text after "ok" or " violation" in this and other lines. On exact code there is no "if".

Please add example of behavior on default config.
Please share CLI output of config and example code to prove that Check is actually behave like shown in your example

thanks a lot, keep ding this format of prove for each code sample.
Now please make sure that documentation is looks like:
<<default config>>
<<code sample>>
some words explanation for config below
<<config>>
<<code sample>>
some words explanation for config below
<<config>>
<<code sample>>

you have code sample NOT under default config. Default config is at 2259 line.

➜  check_style_test git:(master) ✗ cat MyTest.java                                             
public class MyTest {
    public static void myTest() {
	int a; int b;		 	// OK
	int a;int b;			// violation
		
        testMethod(foo, bar); 	// OK
        testMethod(foo,bar);  	// violation

        for (;;) {} // OK
    }
}
➜  check_style_test git:(master) ✗ cat my_checks.xml | sed -n '/WhitespaceAfter/{p;n;p;n;p}'     
	<module name="WhitespaceAfter">
  	<property name="tokens" value="COMMA, SEMI"/>
	</module>
➜  check_style_test git:(master) ✗ checkstyle -c my_checks.xml MyTest.java | grep WhitespaceAfter
[WARN] /home/nick/check_style_test/MyTest.java:4:14: ';' is not followed by whitespace. [WhitespaceAfter]
[WARN] /home/nick/check_style_test/MyTest.java:7:23: ',' is not followed by whitespace. [WhitespaceAfter]
OK. I think I've got everything taken care of here, thanks for being patient!

Please remove class definition, the less  unnecessary code in example the better.
Your code is not compilable, so extra code does no good.
Do you know why this is ok ? If this is big it it is better to not put it in example.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -62,6 +62,23 @@ * 
  * <module name="WhitespaceAfter"/>
  *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * public class MyTest {
+ *  public static void myTest() {
+ *      if (foo) {              // OK
+ *              //...
+ *      } else if(bar) {        // violation
+ *              //...
+ *      }
+ *
+ *      testMethod(foo, bar);   // OK
+ *      testMethod(foo,bar);    // violation
+ *
+ *      for(;;){}               // OK

nodes.bodyText:
This is the intended behavior:

Checks that a token is followed by whitespace, with the exception that it does not check for whitespace after the semicolon of an empty for iterator. Use Check EmptyForIteratorPad to validate empty for iterators.

So, I thought it best to show that.
nodes.diffHunk:

  * <module name="WhitespaceAfter"/>
  *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * public class MyTest {
+ *  public static void myTest() {
+ *      if (foo) {              // OK
+ *              //...
+ *      } else if(bar) {        // violation
+ *              //...
+ *      }
+ *
+ *      testMethod(foo, bar);   // OK
+ *      testMethod(foo,bar);    // violation
+ *
+ *      for(;;){}               // OK
